intro: Aglaia luzoniensis, commonly known as the Luzon aglaia, is a species of flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and related trees. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, fragrant flowers that are typically yellow or greenish-yellow in color. It produces small, round fruits that contain several seeds. Aglaia luzoniensis is often found in lowland and montane forests, growing as a shrub or small tree.
